Description: Attic red figured pottery skyphos (mended from numerous fragments); interior glazed black; exterior: A) red-figure decoration consisting of satyr seated to right on a rock, wearing wreath of three pointed leaves, with thyrsos resting on left shoulder, clasping left knee; facing him, a woman in a patterned peplos and dot border holding a phiale in her right hand and a trefoil oinochoe lowered in her left; B) remains of a male figure (head lost) possibly in a short belted chiton standing to right and resting his foot on a rock and holding two spears upright; on right, part of a mostly eroded figure perhaps moving rapidly to left; under handles, palmettes and spirals; flanking scenes, volutes; below, dilute band, reserved band and lowest part of body glazed; ring foot black with reserved resting surface and underside .
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (F35)
CVA British Museum 4 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 5, British Museum 4 (pl. XXXI, no. 3)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0360) (Phase 1)
